Posts.Content: Hi Eden.  I'm just coming to the end of 18 Taxol treatments.  I lost my hair but found chemo manageable.  If you are in Bromley check out the Primrose centre - they have really helped me.  I'm in Beckenham so if you want to meet up for coffee let me know.  Good luck for Thursday.  I didn't get on with the cold cap but people who did say - take a thick hair band and take some painkillers beforehand.
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Pizza and ice cream delivery but without the pizza?
Posts.Title: What today was like.....

Posts.Content: Does anyone have any experience of Porto Caths?  I had one put in as my veins are always bad but they struggle to get blood out via it but seem to be able to do the chemo through it. As well as three goes via Porto cath it took 5 attempts to get blood out of different veins.  It took 2.5 hours just to get my bloods done today.
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Thanks, I'll see if I can organize an xray
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Jen, I find day after chemo the worst.  I just want to sleep but rest of the time pretty much ok. I didn't use a cold cap and had my hair cut into a short style due to scalp pain.  It hurt for another day and I was planning on having it shaved but pain now gone so will just wait. In on 4/18 of Packitaxol.
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****
